name: Avoid code injection
associatedValueName: Call stack from user input source down to the target method
description: This quality rule detects code injection vulnerabilities by identifying data flow paths where user-controlled input reaches code evaluation or execution methods without proper validation. The rule searches for scenarios where externally-influenced data is used to construct and execute dynamic code, creating potential attack vectors for malicious code injection.
output:
List all methods that make resource calls forged by user input

It provides the following information:
 - Method full name
 - Call stack from user input source down to the target method.
rationale:
Code injection vulnerabilities allow attackers to execute arbitrary code within the application's context, potentially leading to:
-Complete system compromise and unauthorized access
-Data theft, modification, or destruction
-Privilege escalation and lateral movement within systems
-Denial of service attacks
-Bypassing authentication and authorization controls
Unlike other injection types, code injection directly executes attacker-controlled logic, making it one of the most severe vulnerability classes.
reference:
CWE-94: Improper Control of Generation of Code ('Code Injection')
https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/94.html

CWE-95: Improper Neutralization of Directives in Dynamically Evaluated Code ('Eval Injection')
https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/95.html

Open Web Application Security Project (OWASP)  Top ten - Injection category
https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Top_10-2017_A1-Injection
https://owasp.org/Top10/A03_2021-Injection/

CISQ: ASCSM-CWE-078
remediation:
-Avoid dynamic code execution: eliminate the use of code evaluation functions when possible. Consider alternative approaches like configuration files, lookup tables, or predefined function mappings.
-Input validation: if dynamic code execution is absolutely necessary, implement strict allow-listing of permitted inputs using regular expressions or predefined value sets.
alternativeName: Ensure your application does not evaluate unsanitized code.
